Description: Attic black-glazed pottery shallow bowl (fragments missing from rim and foot); projecting rim, grooved underneath; moulded ring foot with concave upper and convex lower member; interior glazed black with, from centre, double incised circle, cross of four stamped palmettes, double circle, circle of seven palmettes); 13 impressed palmettes on top of rim; exterior glazed black; reserved waist of foot and underside, which has a glazed central dot, two circles and a band.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context ΦA (Well 1)
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1823)
